alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 4:19AM PST until January 06 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN TODAY... .Moderate to heavy snow is impacting the Inland Northwest this morning. Snowfall rates around Wenatchee, Chelan, Omak, and into the East Slopes of the Cascades have been very heavy and on the order of 1 to 2 inches per hour. All Cascade Passes are closed at this time. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 2 feet. * WHERE...Holden Village, Stehekin, and Stevens Pass. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Snowfall rates of 2 inches or more per hour are expected this morning. Wet and heavy snow will produce severe winter driving conditions and the potential for localized tree damage due to heavy snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on the heavy snow situation.
